hanzi-su-wiki:
悩

Значения

Страдать, мучиться, переживать

Мнемоника

Человек страдает, если голова (череп 凶 с шевелюрой волос) находится в разладе с сердцем 忄.

Варианты

惱, 恼
purpleculture_pinyin:
nǎo
Japanese variant of 恼
Японский вариант 恼
rtega_mnemonic:
惱惱RS
恼恼		悩angered, filled with hate, troubled
  • heart 忄 angered or troubled by somebody's bad ideas 𡿺
heisig_constituent: trouble, Freud, state of mind, owl, villain, sheaf, shovel
Keyword_KANJIDIC: trouble, worry, in pain, distress, illness
koohiiStory1: When I am in trouble, my state of mind is on two sides: 1. The wise part of me (owl) 2. The villain part of me (villain) Think of the devil and the angel on your shoulders in a troubled situation.
koohiiStory2: The owl villain is the one that troubles me most of all the super-villains. He´s just so smart... you never know what he´ll do! Definitely enough to put you in a troubled state of mind.
kunYomi: なや.む、なや.ます、なや.ましい、なやみ
jp_example_words:
悩ましい(なやましい): seductive, melancholy, languid
悩ます(なやます): to afflict, to torment, to harass, to molest
悩み(なやみ): trouble(s), worry, distress, anguish, agony, problem
悩む(なやむ): be worried, be troubled
jp_readingExamples: 悩ます (なや.ます), 悩む (なや.む)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If your soul is lying in the grass in a treasure chest, you're going to worry about it. It's just sitting there, out in the open, waiting for anyone to come and open it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture your soul curled up inside this treasure chest that's just sitting out on the grass. Anyone could open it up and look inside, and this worries you quite a bit!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Unfortunately, you also worry about opening it yourself. You stand in front of the chest and think, "Should I open it? Nah, yah (なや). Wait. Nah. Yah. Dang, you can't make up your mind.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You worry about what you'll find if you look directly at your soul. But you also worry about what will happen if someone else looks. So you're stuck in a constant state of worrying: nah or yah?!
Ru_Meaning: trouble, worry, in pain, distress, illness
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the villain's (凶) small (⺍) heart (忄) is troubled

Name meaning

nǎo
яп. вм. 恼
Radicals: 忄, 凶  (soul, treasure-chest, grass)
Meaning Mnemonic
If your soul is lying in the grass in a treasure chest, you're going to worry about it. It's just sitting there, out in the open, waiting for anyone to come and open it.
Picture your soul curled up inside this treasure chest that's just sitting out on the grass. Anyone could open it up and look inside, and this worries you quite a bit!
Reading Mnemonic
Unfortunately, you also worry about opening it yourself. You stand in front of the chest and think, "Should I open it? Nah, yah (なや). Wait. Nah. Yah. Dang, you can't make up your mind.
You worry about what you'll find if you look directly at your soul. But you also worry about what will happen if someone else looks. So you're stuck in a constant state of worrying: nah or yah?!
